smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found; all pages contain UML elements.
All use cases in the diagrams are associated with actors, either directly or through «include» relationships (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid' is included by 'Aktiveeri auto').
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No disconnected redundant data columns were identified. Common columns like 'nimetus' store distinct data for their respective entities (e.g., brand name vs. category name).
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb Noun' pattern (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable via transitions from the Start node.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.

On Page 12 (Diagram: Autode register (Klassifikaator)), the association relationship between the class 'Auto' and 'Auto_kategooria_omamine' has a multiplicity indicator ('0..*') on the 'Auto' end but is missing the multiplicity indicator on the 'Auto_kategooria_omamine' end.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The largest diagrams (Page 15) contain 9 tables.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connections on a single diagram. The maximum observed is 5 connections for 'Isik' on Page 6.
The layout of elements is reasonably uniform with no extreme distances between related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names with 3 or fewer characters were found (excluding standard acronyms).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular.
On Pages 7 and 8, the class 'Klassifikaator' contains attributes that start with an uppercase letter: 'Nimetus', 'On_aktiivne', and 'Kood'.
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like tbl_, str_) were found on central elements.
